channel.title: Requesting Help Getting a Server Running!
channel.description:
Dear MoparScape Forums, I have worked several hours on a server that I can't get running and I am at wits end. I have been following tutorials to the last detail but I can seem to get any luck what so ever. I am requesting help from anyone with any experience to assist me via the following: Yahoo Messenger, Team Viewer, or even Skype. The Problem I am having is that I can't get on my on server and I can't get others on it.
Thanks in Advance, Blade908
Skype: Supercross908 Teamviewer: Request Via Skype or PM Yahoo Messenger: xPerseus@ymail.com

item.title: Requesting Help Getting a Server Running!
item.dc:creator: @Blade908 Blade908
item.description:
@Blade908 wrote:

Sorry Dark Wing Sam Here helped me solve my problem but thanks for the Input!

PROBLEM RESOLVED!

Read full topic
item.source: Requesting Help Getting a Server Running!

item.title: Requesting Help Getting a Server Running!
item.dc:creator: @xldarkwinglx xldarkwinglx
item.description:
@xldarkwinglx wrote:

OK, 1st of all did you port forward? That could be one reason. Another reason is that it says server already in use or online. If so you have to close out utorrent 100%. Close it by going into your task bar and right clicking on the green box with the u in it and clicking Exit. Then turn on your server and then turn utorrent back on. If you didnt turn your server on in the 1st place you have serious problems. But thats about all I can think of. Please tell me if I helped

Read full topic
item.source: Requesting Help Getting a Server Running!

item.title: Requesting Help Getting a Server Running!
item.dc:creator: @A_L_I_V_E A L I V E
item.description:
@A_L_I_V_E wrote:

It’s probably your connection settings. See that little bar at the bottom right hand corner? (Where the time is)

1.Right click on your connections

2.And then hit properties

3.Go to Advanced

4.Enable Internet Connection Sharing

5.And then hit settings below it

6.Enable all the boxes.

Check back with me if you have any problem.

Read full topic
item.source: Requesting Help Getting a Server Running!

item.title: Requesting Help Getting a Server Running!
item.dc:creator: @Ground_zero_317 Ground zero 317
item.description:
@Ground_zero_317 wrote:

portforward and then check see if your port is open after using portforward checker and then if it open make a no ip adress and put the no ip adress in gui or client folder dependening on what ur using

Read full topic
